text: Pandanus carmichaelii is a species of plant in the family Pandanaceae. It is endemic to Mauritius. ==Description== It can be distinguished from many of its closest relatives by its small, round fruit-head (15 cm), which is partially enclosed in protective bracts . The 125-150 drupes in the fruit-head do not protrude from the surface, but are a bit compressed, with flat stigmas, and exposed tips that are flat and angular. Its leaves are rigid and curved upwards, with abrupt, acute tips. ==Habitat== Its natural habitat is swamps. It is threatened by habitat loss and only survives in the high altitude area around Le Petrin. ==References== carmichaelii Category:Endemic flora of Mauritius Category:Critically endangered plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Pandanus carmichaelii
